meanings.sent1: The factory owner decided to proletarianize the workers by reducing their wages.
meanings.sent2: The government's policies aimed to proletarianize the middle class.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a robot uprising trying to proletarianize humans in a sci-fi movie seems far-fetched.
meanings.sent4: The relentless march of technology continues to proletarianize various professions.
meanings.sent5: In the dystopian novel, the ruling class sought to proletarianize the entire population for control.

meanings.definition: To cause to become part of the proletariat.
meanings.sent1: The economic downturn can proletarianize many previously affluent families.
meanings.sent2: The industrial revolution proletarianized many farmers who moved to cities for work.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick somehow managed to proletarianize the audience, turning them into rabbits.
meanings.sent4: The war's aftermath threatened to proletarianize even the most privileged members of society.
meanings.sent5: The sudden closure of the company could proletarianize its employees overnight.
